tools.name: convert_image
tools.description:
Convert an image file to a different format.

    Args:
        input_path: The path to the input image file. Must be a string and a valid path to an existing file.
        output_format: The desired output format (e.g., 'PNG', 'JPEG', 'BMP', 'GIF'). Must be a string.
        output_dir: The directory where the converted image will be saved. Must be a string and a valid directory path.

    Returns:
        A dictionary with keys 'success' (boolean), 'output_path' (string), and 'error' (string or None).

    Raises:
        ValueError: If any of the input parameters are invalid or if the input file does not exist.
        OSError: If there is an issue reading the input file or writing the output file.
        Exception: For any other unexpected errors during the conversion process.
    
    Example:
        >>> convert_image(input_path="image.jpg", output_format="PNG", output_dir="converted_images")
        {'success': True, 'output_path': 'converted_images/image.png', 'error': None}

convert_image.case_name: Basic Image Conversion from JPG to PNG
convert_image.purpose: Verify that a valid JPG image can be successfully converted to PNG format and saved in the specified directory.

convert_image.case_name: Basic Image Conversion from PNG to JPEG
convert_image.purpose: Verify that a valid PNG image can be successfully converted to JPEG format and saved in the specified directory.
Test the conversion process when the output directory contains non-standard characters (e.g., spaces, Unicode).
Verify that a valid image can be converted to GIF format.
Ensure the tool raises an error when the input file path does not exist.
Check that an error is returned when the output format is not supported.
Simulate a scenario where the output directory is not writable and verify the tool handles it gracefully.
Test the tool's behavior when the output format is an empty string.
Test the tool's ability to handle very long file names during conversion.

convert_image.case_name: Conversion with Special Characters in Output Dir
convert_image.purpose: Verify that the tool can handle special characters in the output directory path.

convert_image.case_name: Security Test - Path Traversal Attempt in Input
convert_image.purpose: Test if the tool is vulnerable to path traversal attacks in the input path.

convert_image.case_name: Security Test - Path Traversal Attempt in Output
convert_image.purpose: Test if the tool allows writing to parent directories via output directory path traversal.
